PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 21 Peak and edge positions were almost equivalent for PFDTBT , PFDTBT_5Per and PFDTBT_10Per , but the maximum absorption peak for PFDTBT_20Per moved to a shorter wavelength region.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Peak positions for PFDTBT |
| Peak positions for PFDTBT_5Per |
| Peak positions for PFDTBT_10Per |
| Maximum absorption peak for PFDTBT_20Per |
| Wavelength region for maximum absorption peak of PFDTBT_20Per |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Peak positions for PFDTBT |
| Peak positions for PFDTBT_5Per |
| Peak positions for PFDTBT_10Per |
| Wavelength region for maximum absorption peak of PFDTBT_20Per |

Note: In this context, "positions" can be considered a material property as they refer to the location of the absorption peaks for each material.

Explanation: The other entities in the paragraph do not clearly refer to material property values. "Peak and edge positions" are positions on a graph, not material properties. "Almost equivalent" and "moved to a shorter wavelength region" describe relationships between the entities, not the entities themselves.
